project_name: OP Medicine â€“ Filecoin-Powered Healthcare Infrastructure
filecoin_growth_impact:
The project directly contributes to the Filecoin economy by enabling FIL-denominated transactions across medical billing, decentralized storage subscriptions, and open-source software development â€” totaling approximately $15,000 USD equivalent to date.

We launched PPT and MEDI Tokens on the Filecoin Mainnet, integrated with SushiSwap for liquidity and payment routing. These tokens facilitate real-world FIL utility in healthcare and civic data systems.

Additionally, FIL payments are used for mentoring developers to deploy Filecoin smart contracts for health data handling, claims management, and recurring billing, expanding FILâ€™s application beyond storage into sustainable Web3 public-good infrastructure.

description:
OP Medicine on Filecoin builds open, verifiable healthcare infrastructure using Filecoin storage and FVM smart contracts.

 Since November 2024, it has powered two Code for GovTech healthcare pilots, deploying decentralized medical billing, token-gated data pipelines, and transparent clinical record systems anchored on Filecoin/IPLD.

In 2025, OP Medicine launched the PPT Token on Filecoin Mainnet and SushiSwap, enabling token-gated access to the Web3 Medical Billing system.

 Through EMTTR, the project delivers affordable, auditable, and privacy-first digital health tools for hospitals, researchers, and civic projects â€” advancing Filecoinâ€™s real-world public good adoption.
additional_impact:
The project has created public-good infrastructure connecting Filecoin to healthcare and government data systems, demonstrating its real-world viability beyond financial applications.

It has promoted Filecoin adoption across academic and civic innovation networks such as NSUT, Code for GovTech, and Gates Foundationâ€“linked programs, fostering education and awareness around decentralized storage and verifiable data protocols.

Through the Smart India Hackathon (S.I.H.), the project enabled participation of 600+ developers, introducing Filecoin-based problem statements and cross-ecosystem integrations with Starknet and Stellar via py-libp2p: please visit https://github.com/seetadev/py-libp2p/issues , https://github.com/libp2p/py-libp2p/discussions/1004 and https://github.com/libp2p/py-libp2p/discussions/933 (project areas for S.I.H. 2026).

One of the OP Medicine maintainers also serves as a co-maintainer of key Filecoin ecosystem libraries â€” py-libp2p, py-multiaddr (multiformats), and py-cid (IPLD) â€” directly advancing the developer infrastructure that underpins Filecoinâ€™s interoperability.

ðŸ”—Community presentation on py-libp2p use cases at Engres, The Gathering (please visit https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2x1cOfSsSys )

The project has also advanced privacy-first medical data standards, leveraging ZK proofs and IPLD-based record verifiability to ensure secure, auditable data provenance.

Collectively, these efforts have expanded Filecoinâ€™s visibility and utility across the digital public health, education, and open-source civic-tech ecosystems â€” positioning it as a trusted backbone for non-financial, public-benefit use cases.
end_user:
Our end users include:

Public hospitals & civic healthcare agencies using OP Medicine for transparent billing and data records.

Developers & startups integrating Filecoin-powered medical data systems through EMTTR APIs.

Patients & TPAs (medical insurers) who gain auditable and verifiable medical records.

Research institutions (like NSUT and C4GT pilots) leveraging Filecoin storage for clinical trials and public health data pipelines.

top_five_dependents:
Currently 5 FVM-based projects use OP Medicineâ€™s smart contract modules for Filecoin data anchoring and verifiable billing: please visit https://github.com/aspiringsecurity/EMTTR/blob/main/Filecoin-RetroPGF.md 

Medi Assist: Filecoin-based medical data pipelines. Please visit: https://medi-assist-deploy.vercel.app/  
Deployment of PPT and Medi Token on Sushiswap, 
FVM Mainnet: https://github.com/aspiringsecurity/EMTTR/blob/main/Filecoin-RetroPGF.md#-quick-links 

Eth Elder Ease is a public-healthcare pilot that integrates OP Medicineâ€™s ZK-enabled billing on Filecoin with Storacha for tamper-resistant storage of medical records and billing receipts. The Storacha discussion thread contains full, step-by-step integration documentation and progress updates: https://github.com/orgs/storacha/discussions?discussions_q=is%3Aopen+eth+elder+ease

Web3 Medical Invoice: Token-Gated Medical Invoicing on Web3 using Storacha for decentralized data provenance. Filecoin data access & subscription DApp using PPT Token (please visit https://github.com/aspiringsecurity/EMTTR/blob/main/Filecoin-RetroPGF.md#-developer-repositories )

C4GT Health Pilot (India) â€” Public hospital billing & research record infrastructure on Filecoin and IPFS  (deployments shared at https://sites.google.com/view/emttrservice/ ).  

Web3-kyc-lit sdk and OSS tool â€” Filecoin-linked KYC & access module via Lit Protocol (https://github.com/seetadev/web3-kyc-lit/tree/dev )
filecoin_users_percentage_using_project:
Approximately 120+ installs across OP Medicine on Filecoin and related SDK repositories since November 2024, primarily from Filecoin ecosystem contributors and Code for GovTech alumni developers participating in pilot deployments.

While this represents an early-stage but growing user base, these installs reflect engagement from active Filecoin buildersâ€”including those working with Storacha, libp2p, and FEVM. OP Medicine on Filecoin and associated SDKs currently support a focused segment of the Filecoin developer community, estimated at 5â€“8% of Filecoin-affiliated contributors.

As adoption scales across Storacha, Filecoin Onchain Cloud, IPFS, and open-source partners, broader network participation is expected.
